title: "Code" bold Bauhaus-like geometric display sans
content:
I would really appreciate if someone could help me identify this font. I have tried whatthefont and had no success.

thanks in advance

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [cc\_small.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080108031340/http:/typophile.com/files/cc_small.jpg) | 8.65 KB |

 [‹ "Good Wood Gang" Big chunky chiseled serif--anything like this out there?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080108031340/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38563 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) MacGyver: The Complete First Season DVD menu - Serpentine, ITC Symbol {Raph, Loremipsum} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080108031340/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38515 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Nerra

comments.content: Its not Bauhaus Bold or the old Apple Computer logo typeface Motter Tektura.
Still looking for this font, its driving me crazy.

Warren,

what makes you so sure that this is in fact a font and not just custom drawn for the logo? Have you seen other letters? This is very geometric and could be redrawn in Illustrator in no time.

Seb
Staypretty’s [Isis](http://web.archive.org/web/20080108031340/http:/www.staypretty.net/fonts/isis/) is similar but no match...

I think J Printy was on the right track - it could be an altered Motter Tektura. The e gives it away.

Nick Cooke
I see both “Code” and “Coda”. That’s sort of a dangerous line to straddle.
